title: Record-keeping (automatic logging) for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: High-risk AI systems shall technically allow for the automatic recording of events (logs) over the lifetime of the system.

legal_consequence.verbatim: High-risk AI systems shall technically allow for the automatic recording of events (logs) over the lifetime of the system.

items.label: Logging capabilities and purposes
items.text: Logging should enable traceability appropriate to the intended purpose, including identifying risky situations, facilitating post‑market monitoring, and monitoring certain operations referred to in Article 26(5).

items.label: Specifics for Annex III 1(a) systems
items.text: For remote biometric identification systems, minimum logs include period of use, reference database, matched input data, and identification of verifying natural persons.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for non‑compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).
